messages.title: A PERSONAL MESSAGE FROM DAVID CAMERON
messages.content: David Cameron writes why we need change in Britain today.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Fighting Labour's cuts to Suffolk's NHS services
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Resisting essential heart attack and cancer care service at Ipswich Hospital, and re-opening Hartismere Hospital.
Fighting for a fair deal for Suffolk communities and pensioners.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Supporting local Businesses, Shops, and Pubs
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Favors fairer business support for Suffolk communities, aiding the protection and creation of jobs.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Supporting energy conservation and alternative energy projects
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Reduce carbon emissions and save bills while opposing Labour's plans to concrete over the Suffolk countryside by building 15,000 new houses around Ipswich.

issues.environment: Opposes Labour's plans to concrete over the Suffolk countryside.
issues.health: Pledges to resist NHS service cuts and re-open a local hospital.

housing.content: Opposes Labour's plans to build 15,000 new houses around Ipswich.

politicalExperience.achievements: Delivered multi-million pound regeneration and new employment projects.

politicalExperience.role: Clinical lead for homeless people and helped raise money for Help for Heroes

contactInformation.address: 17 The Business Centre, Earl Soham, Woodbridge, Suffolk

images.caption: Poulter with residents, healthcare professionals and in the community.
